bio.p: Michelle Owens-Gary, PhD, is a behavioral scientist in the Division of Diabetes Translation at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. She serves as a staff member of the National Diabetes Education Program, where she works on topics related to diabetes and youth, gestational diabetes, and mental health.

Pamela Allweiss, MD, MPH, works for the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Division of Diabetes Translation, in Atlanta, Georgia. She is an endocrinologist who also finished a residency in occupational medicine. She works with the National Diabetes Education Program and the CDC sponsored National Healthy Worksite Program.
